questions.question: As a result of the French and Indian War,

choices.answer: Native Americans gained control of the Great Lakes region
Britain lost control of lands east of the Mississippi River
France turned Canada over to Britain
France gained control of Florida

questions.question: What was the major outcome of the French and Indian War?

choices.answer: Native Americans surrendered the Great Lakes region
The French surrendered all of Canada to the British
The British promised independence to the colonies
The British turned over all of Canada to the French

questions.question: Why did many colonists protest the Stamp Act?

choices.answer: The act enabled the British to censor all written materials in the colonies
The act threatened to disrupt trading patterns with overseas markets
The act increased the cost of British imports
the act taxed the colonists without their consent

questions.question: The results of the Battle of Saratoga

choices.answer: destroyed morale among the American colonists
encouraged Britain to end the Revolutionary War immediately
convinced the French to ally themselves with the Americans
orced the Americans to retreat from the area around Trenton

questions.question: American victory in the Revolutionary War led to

choices.answer: expanded political and legal power for women
the abolition of slavery in the Southern Colonies
the strengthening of the Iroquois League
the spread of the idea of liberty at home and abroad

questions.question: After the fall of Quebec, eastern North America was controlled by

choices.answer: the French
the British
the French and Native Americans
the colonists

questions.question: The colonists protested the Stamp Act because they believed in

choices.answer: one man, one vote
no taxation without representation
liberty, equality, and fraternity
freedom of speech

questions.question: In the pamphlet Common Sense, the author argues that the colonies should

choices.answer: establish a monarchy
negotiate a peaceful settlement with Britain
break their ties with Britain
use war as a last resort

questions.question: The Battle of Yorktown resulted in

choices.answer: a victory for the Patriot navy
the capture of Hessian mercenaries
the signing of the Treaty of Paris
a Patriot retreat into Virginia

questions.question: The Revolutionary War began with the

choices.answer: Battle of Saratoga
Battle of Trenton
Battles of Lexington and Concord
Battle of Bunker Hill

questions.question: The idea of natural rights is best defined as

choices.answer: individual's duties to their government
the economic interests of the people
a government's powers over its citizens
rights belonging to all people because they are human

questions.question: The Americans won the Revolutionary War mainly because

choices.answer: their armies were better trained and disciplined than the British
British Arms were inferior to American arms
they had the determination to outlast the British
the American navy was superior to the British navy

questions.question: Which best describes British-American relations after the French and Indian War?

choices.answer: The British began to respect American culture
The colonists began to question British authority
The British began to treat Americans as equals
The colonists became more dependent on Britain

questions.question: The political ideas of Thomas Jefferson were greatly influenced by

choices.answer: the Olive Branch Petition
the Albany Plan of Union
the Enlightenment
The Battle of Yorktown

questions.question: In response to increasing tensions between the colonists and the British, the colonists

choices.answer: began to pay British taxes
organize militias
burned Anglican churches
demanded the right to vote
